p: Coriander volatile oil is prepared from Coriander sativum. The oil displays significant anxiolytic- and antidepressant-like effects [ 31]. Moreover, coriander volatile oil decreased the catalase activity and increased glutathione level in the hippocampus [ 31]. The multiple exposures to coriander volatile oil can be useful as a means to counteract anxiety, depression, and oxidative stress in Alzheimer’s disease conditions. The GC-MS and GC-FID analyses determined the main volatile component of the coriander volatile oil sample to be linalool (69.4%), which is probably the responsible constituent for the observed anxiolytic- and antidepressant-like effects. This assumption was confirmed by the fact that inhaling linalool rich EOs can be useful as a means to counteract anxiety [ 35, 62]. Other minor constituents of coriander volatile oil are α-pinene (3.0%–7.0%) and γ-terpinene (1.5–8.0%) [ 31].
